answers.answer: You are likely describing background diabetic retinopathy. You should be under the care of a Eye MD ophthalmologist physician. Most cases do not require treatment however it can progress to diabetic macular edema or proliferative diabetic retinopathy which require laser surgery.Keep you A1C below 6.0, keep your blood pressure down, your cholesterol down, your weight down, don't smoke, exercise, eat a good diet, see an ophthalmologist once or twice per year and your diabetic MD every six months.Even if you do this after diabetes has been present 10-15 years most diabetics have some background DR.JCH MD

question: I am 68, have Diabetes II since last 10 years. blood sugar is always in control, have normal blood pressure. I take Lisinoapril to protect Kidney. Take metformin and glypizide for glucose.I walk 40 minute everyday. My dialation results say that there is a dot & blot in my right eye close to vascular or macular or somthing like that word.Could you please enlighten on this and about the cure for this? Thank you.
title: eye care
